content.description:
A left variant to Ivy League formerly referred to as the BRRRRRAAAAAATTTT project.

 Start sitting on the left undercling and right pinch where Ivy League begins. Do the first move left into the slot crimp in the roof on Ivy League, then make a very long right hand deadpoint over the lip over the roof to an edge typically used for a heel on Ivy League. Figure out how to get your body weight out from under the roof and climb leftwards to the arete and up to a no-hands stance on a ledge where Ivy League also finishes. Downclimb, drop off, or top out through the jungle above. The lip holds used for Ivy League are off-route aside from the leftmost one (foot only).
content.location: Starts sitting below the Spider on a left triangular undercling and right crimp pinch, as for Ivy League.

content.description: Starts on two undercling side-pulls, then left hand to crimp and right hand throw to pinch. Finishes on jug further up the wall.

Climb the dihedral, several ways to do this.  I start on the good edge to the right of the dihedral then move left.  Laying back on a good crimp to a pinch, and a cool body tension move to grab the finish jug. 

  Jump down from the jug.
content.location: One of the first problems on the wall in the grey dihedral.

content.description:
Low start to Rogue Dentistry. Start below and left of the opposing sidepulls Rogue Dentistry starts on using a very good left hand jug in the roof and a right juggy edge near the skirt on the bottom of the roof. Pull on and move through a core-and-bicep-sapping compression boulder to a difficult setup on the start holds of Rogue Dentistry, then finish out that line.

 Thanks to Carlos for spotting this line and Stefan for providing interesting beta vision and nearly sending before moving to Germany! Glad to make this one a reality.
content.location: Starts on a very good left jug in the roof and right juggy edge at the transition from roof to skirt at the bottom of the roof, left and below the opposing sidepulls start of Rogue Dentistry.

content.description: Jump Start to a decent hold, crimp out left and up. Jump Down.
content.location: Follow tangerine wall until you pass the Cult Boulder. This route is on the right side of an arete immediately past the Cult Boulder.

content.description: Traverse bouldering problem starting from the left and working towards the right. Start hold is a  solid jug, followed by a slight side-cling out to the right. Follow the ridge mid-wall. This point is the crux, with few good foot holds and lots of smearing. After the crux, some high pockets and a ridge will give you solid hand holds with pockets for feet. Finish on the right side of the corner.
content.location: From the stone steps, turn right and cross a bridge. Follow the trail left to the beginning of the wall. Find on the far left of the tangerine wall.

content.description:
Powerful roof climbing. Start on two good underclings on a bulge, figure out the heel, and power up to another undercling/pinch and fire for a slopey pocket. Continue up the face and top out.

 Now V10 again after major hold break.
content.location: Left of the Chili Pepper, the next roof section. Scramble up the hill above the problem to the trail and walk off.

content.description:
Start sitting on two underclings as for Red Hot Chili Pepper, but up and slightly right through tensiony underclings and a long move to a pocket crimp, then move right once established over the roof to finish on the same jug flake feature as Wildflower. 

  Might have been done before, but nothing matches the description in the old guide. An interesting eliminate that's harder than everything else on that section of wall, plus it stays relatively dry after a rain.
content.location: Starts sitting as for Red Hot Chili Pepper

content.description: One of the best boulder problems in Muscatatuck. Sit start on a decent undercling and make a move to a sloper. Slap to another sloper, throw a heel and make a hard move to a slopey edge. Continue to the top of the bulge to an obvious knob above the sloping rail. Jump Down.
content.location: A ways down tangerine wall, underneath an obvious bulge. Next to the Pink Boulder.

content.description: Start on an undercling and small crimp just above it. Move up and right to the obvious bulge in the corner. Then use a series of side-pulls and gastons to move left and up. Finish on the large triangle cut rail about 12-15 feet up.Not positive this is an FA. This is a variation of a current project "Toes of Gaia" which starts on the same holds below, but moves left to small crimp rail to start. Wanted to respect the Project's line as a variation although these two are very similar. "Toes of Gaia" is more like V10.
content.location: Just left of Ivy league and just right of Wild Flower

content.description: Starts on head level holds in black dihedral. Left on a decent crimp and right on a slopey crimp. Move up and right through undercling and then triangular edge. Big reach around the arete to a blind hold. Finish matched on the ledge. Downclimb the crack.
content.location: In the black dihedral to the right of Ivy League/Spider. To the left around the arete from Paisley Dragon.

content.description: Many ways to do it, all of similiar difficulty.  Start by underclinging below a bulge then move right into dihedral.  Problem ends at obvious jug rail.  There is a pointed block right below it that you use.
content.location: Just left of hicks on skoal and before the spider.

content.description: Left hand starts high on a good hold (starting right hand for Alliteration V0) and right hand starts low on a good side pull (about a foot down and left of the large slopey undercling). Move right to crimp rail and then left hand crimp and finish on jug shelf. Jump down or mantle to top of ledge. Crux is finding and deciding which feet to use. Alternative Start: Start with left hand slopey undercling and hop to right hand crimp rail.
content.location: On an arete in between Hicks on Skoal and Tangerine.

content.description: Direct Start to the Spider. Sit Start on roof below the Spider on a pinch and undercling. Deadpoint to a small crimp, move to an undercling, pull a hard move to a positive sidepull at the lip of the roof. Campus to good edges and finish on the spider. V10 approximate difficulty, using The Red Hot Chili Pepper as a guideline. May be harder or easier. Tendency to seep during heavy rain. Rad sequence.
content.location: Begins under small roof below The Spider.

content.description: Stand start on big undercling jug, plaster feet and negotiate the 'incisor' hold to establish on the hold options above it. Then, make a long move to the pocket jug on Rogue Dentistry. To top, continue through the line of pockets straight up and right to the top of the cliff.
content.location: Left of the Chili Pepper, the next roof section. Just right of Rogue Dentistry, start in the obvious undercling jug.

content.description: Start on the same double sidepulls as Wildflower. Move left through slopey ledge and high crimps. Finish on the same knob as The Red Hot Chili Pepper finishes. *Beta: Wear a shirt.
Use sidepulls in the dihedral to layback.  I used these to get high right foot on the arete.  Easy ground after that.  End on jug rail.
content.location: Arete and dihedral directly in front of a tree, just right of paisley dragon.

content.description: Adds an even harder traverse to the already classic The Red Hot Chili Pepper problem. Start on the same double sidepulls as Wildflower. Traverse left through the cruxy block undercling pinches in to the beginning of The Red Hot Chili Pepper and then finish the line for The Red Hot Chili Pepper. Finishing matched on the knob. Beta: Get your wrists and biceps nice and warm before trying this thing. Note: A bit contrived considering the easiest way from start to finish would be to go the Higher Ground route.
content.location: A ways down tangerine wall, underneath an obvious bulge. Next to the Pink Boulder.

content.description: Stand start on selection of crimps at the bottom right of the arete. Climb direct up the arete to the large jug shelf and then jug rail. Finishing no hands stance same as Ivy League/WEH/Spider.
content.location: The overhanging arete just before The Red Hot Chili Pepper. This is the stand start to With Empty Hands.

content.description: Shady in the summer due to trees. Best bet in the rain beacuse a sizable roof protects some routes from the rain. May seep in/after heavy rain. Limestone.
